page.title: 11Leafield Landmarks.
page.content: Barry Tump. Barry Tump is a very old hill.It is in a field which used to be a Roman burial ground.It has a round slope,not much grass and some trees .People say there is a wall through the middle and a black ghost one side and white ghost the other and they have a battle every evening.There is a stone on it which shows its height above sea level. The cross. The cross is on the village green. It looks old and has lots of moss and lichen.The people that survived smallpox put it up in 1873.It says: In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Ghost,Amen. THIS ANCIENT CROSS WAS RESTORED BY THE INHABITANTS OF LEAFIELD AS A MEMORIAL OF THEIR DELIVERANCE FROM THE SCOURGE OF SMALLPOX.
